Viewing the route map
When working with a route object, the user can view its running and completed business processes.
Viewing the business process route map is available:
clicking the
button in the
control panel
;
selecting an instance in the object registry whose route needs to be displayed and clicking the
button in the control panel;
when clicking the
button in the control panel of the
route object
profile;
The conditions for visibility and blocking of the "Route" button in the route object profile are regulated by the
"Route" [SYS_SHOW_WAY]
action
settings.
By default, the System uses action
permissions
for the "All Users" group.
The
button in the route object profile and when selecting an instance in the registry of the
related
object type is available to user if a business process is running for the selected object and at least one of the following conditions is met:
The user has available items in the business process;
The user has the
"Route administration"
and/or
"View technical information for the route"
permissions.
on the
route object
visual.
Example of visual settings
When setting up the related object type, add the existing "Route" (WF_WAY_VIEW) attribute from the list of existing attributes:
Then go to
visual settings
and drag and drop the "Route" attribute from the "Attributes" tab of the "Elements" panel to the profile workspace.
After saving the visual settings, the route will be displayed in the profile:
The system will display the progress of the route object with the stage name, performer, start/end time of the stage, as well as its duration:
The diagram shows the tasks:
/
icons  – completed/active processes and subprocesses;
green – completed tasks.
red – active/incomplete tasks are shown.
In this case, the route progress can be displayed according to the selected attributes in the upper part of the workspace:
"Show backlog only" – displays only the unfinished stages of the business process;
"Of the whole department" – displays the stages of the business process (the progress of the route object) within the departments;
"Show technical info" – displays technical information on the route diagram, including
service tasks
,
service operators (gateways)
,
intermediate events
.
Example of displaying technical information
When the "Show technical info" option is enabled, the process diagram will display not only the main information but also the process start method, the initiator, and service actions:
Displaying technical information on the process diagram is available only to users with the
"Route administration"
and/or
"View technical information for the route"
permissions.
Clicking the stage performer will open the corresponding
employee profile
, and clicking the task name will lead to the
task profile
.
Clicking the process/subprocess name will display the diagram of that business process:
The diagram shows:
green – the completed route stages;
yellow – the
skipped
route stages that failed;
red – the active route stages.
The control panel contains the following buttons:
– the button to save the diagram generated in the workspace on the user’s device in *.svg format;
– the button for accessing the
business process diagram
setting.
The
button is displayed only with the active "Route administration"
permissions
.
